content.question: Which of the following is true in imperfectly competitive markets?

choices.label: Firms produce standardized or identical products.
Firms enjoy economies of scale in production.
Firms produce output at constant marginal cost.
Firms must lower their product prices to sell additional units.
New firms can easily enter or exit the market.

content.answer: Firms must lower their product prices to sell additional units.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
